meanings.definition: Evoking interest, attention, or admiration in a powerful or irresistible way.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a compelling storyline that kept me glued to the screen.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was so compelling that everyone in the audience was captivated.
meanings.sent3: The compelling aroma of freshly baked cookies made it impossible to resist grabbing one.
meanings.sent4: The artist's compelling use of colors created a visual masterpiece that left viewers in awe.
meanings.sent5: The compelling melody of the song lingered in my mind long after it ended.

meanings.sent1: The compelling argument presented by the lawyer swayed the jury in favor of the defendant.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's compelling voice silenced the noisy classroom instantly.
meanings.sent3: His compelling insistence on perfection sometimes bordered on being annoying.
meanings.sent4: The storm's compelling force shook the entire house, causing windows to rattle.
meanings.sent5: The compelling urgency of the situation pushed everyone to act quickly and decisively.

meanings.definition: Having a powerful and irresistible effect.
meanings.sent1: The compelling beauty of the sunset took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: The novel's compelling characters made the story unforgettable.
meanings.sent3: The compelling taste of the chocolate cake made it impossible to stop at just one slice.
meanings.sent4: The compelling charm of the old bookstore drew customers in like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The compelling performance of the actor left the audience in awe and admiration.
